answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!Hypothyroidism, low Vit D levels, low calcium, hypoparathyroididm (low function of parathyroid gland), diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, rheumatism, and lupus are a few things that you should get investigated for. It would be a good idea to consult a rheumatologist for this.It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage.  Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I have been diagnosed with low range of motion in all my joints like 2 years ago and now they hurt really bad all the time and below my elbows and knees i get a tingly feeling a couple times a day.  I find myself taking a lot of ibuprofen and/or naproxen.  Also my face starts to hurt suddenly sometimes only on the right side and it's my cheek forehead and eyes but i don't have a tooth or ear infection.  Another thing is I have bad anxiety and shake from it sometimes.  Also I have suddenly swelled up i was a size 3 and now i'm a size 9. i'm only 19yrs old and i can't figure out why.  I am going to the doctors tomorrow but i hate when they say that i'm over exagerrating on how much my joints and face hurt. I always get told that i just have to strengthen my joints so they don't hurt but i've been doing physical therapy for a long time and it's only gotten worse. Does anyone know what this could be? or have symptoms like this?
title: pain in shoulders, knees, and face
